unnormalised: ## Environmental News: Waste Management Woes & Wins
normalised: ## Environmental News: Waste Management Woes and Wins

unnormalised: Hey folks, let's talk trash! It's not the most glamorous topic, but solid waste management is a BIG deal, especially here in India. Remember those overflowing landfills we saw last summer? Yikes!
normalised: Hey folks, let's talk trash! It's not the most glamorous topic, but solid waste management is a big deal, especially here in India. Remember those overflowing landfills we saw last summer? Yikes!

unnormalised: In Delhi, the MCD (Municipal Corporation of Delhi) is finally rolling out a new pilot project in Rohini, aiming to segregate waste at source – you know, separating your biodegradable stuff from plastics *before* it goes to the bin. They’re even promising composting workshops, starting at 10:00 hrs on 26/07/2024!
normalised: In Delhi, the M C D (Municipal Corporation of Delhi) is finally rolling out a new pilot project in Rohini, aiming to segregate waste at source – you know, separating your biodegradable stuff from plastics before it goes to the bin. unnormalised: But it's not all sunshine and roses. Experts from IIT Bombay say that at the current rate, Mumbai’s Deonar dumping ground will be completely full by next year, sometime around the monsoons. That’s a huge environmental hazard, impacting lakhs of people.
normalised: But it's not all sunshine and roses. Experts from I I T Bombay say that at the current rate, Mumbai’s Deonar dumping ground will be completely full by next year, sometime around the monsoons. That’s a huge environmental hazard, impacting lakhs of people.

unnormalised: On a brighter note, Chennai Corporation recently announced they've cleared approximately 2000 tonnes of legacy waste from Perungudi landfill, and plan to use it to create energy by 15/08/2025. That's some *jugaad*, right?
normalised: On a brighter note, Chennai Corporation recently announced they've cleared approximately two thousand tonnes of legacy waste from Perungudi landfill, and plan to use it to create energy by fifteenth august two thousand and twenty five. That's some jugaad, right?

unnormalised: And in a village near Surat, local women, inspired by Swachh Bharat Abhiyan, have formed a self-help group, collecting and recycling plastic waste, earning Rs. 5000+ a month! Talk about empowerment! Let’s hope this spirit of sustainability spreads faster than the monsoon rains. It’s everyone’s responsibility, from now until 09:00 hrs tomorrow (and beyond!). Let's keep India clean.
